Questions.correct_ans_explanation: Gross Domestic Product of a country includes all final products produced within the borders of that country. Choice I does not fulfill this requirement because the tomatoes are produced in Mexico. Choice II does not fulfill this requirement because used cars are not final goods, but instead second-hand goods; counting second-hand items would result in double-counting because those goods were included in GDP when they were first sold. Finally, both III and IV are considered to be part of GDP because they are produced in the United States
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: Gross Domestic Product of a country includes all final products produced within the borders of that country. Choice I does not fulfill this requirement because the tomatoes are produced in Mexico. Choice II does not fulfill this requirement because used cars are not final goods, but instead second-hand goods; counting second-hand items would result in double-counting because those goods were included in GDP when they were first sold. Finally, both III and IV are considered to be part of GDP because they are produced in the United States
Questions.question:
Which of the following would be considered part of the United States GDP?
I. The market value of tomatoes grown in Mexico by an American citizen
II. The market value of the sale of used cars in the United States
III. The market value of oranges grown in the United States by a Mexican citizen
IV. The market value of apples made in the United States
options:
III only

 I and III only

 III and IV only

 I, II, and IV only

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: Bob’s nominal income refers to the number of dollars earned by Bob. In this case, Bob earned $40,000 more, so his nominal income increased. Real income, on the other hand, takes into account inflation, so if the price level doubled, there was 100% inflation. Real income = nominal income / (1 + inflation rate) = $130,000 / (1 + 1.00) = $65,000. $65,000 is less than $90,000 so real income decreased, therefore the correct answer is A.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: Bob’s nominal income refers to the number of dollars earned by Bob. In this case, Bob earned $40,000 more, so his nominal income increased. Real income, on the other hand, takes into account inflation, so if the price level doubled, there was 100% inflation. Real income = nominal income / (1 + inflation rate) = $130,000 / (1 + 1.00) = $65,000. $65,000 is less than $90,000 so real income decreased, therefore the correct answer is A.
Questions.question: In a given period, the average price level in the United States doubled, and Bob's income increased from $90,000 to $130,000. What happened to Robin's nominal and real income respectively?
options:
Increased 	Decreased

 Increased 	Increased

 Decreased 	Decreased

 Increased 	Stayed the same

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: Gross Domestic Product (GDP) measures the market value of all the final goods and services produced in a specific time period within a certain country, so it is not used to measure inflation. UBI stands for Universal Basic Income and is not associated with inflation. The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is used to measure inflation because it measures changes in the average price level of a basket of consumer goods. The GDP deflator also measures inflation because it is calculated by dividing nominal GDP by real GDP and therefore can be used to determine inflation, so the answer is B.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: Gross Domestic Product (GDP) measures the market value of all the final goods and services produced in a specific time period within a certain country, so it is not used to measure inflation. UBI stands for Universal Basic Income and is not associated with inflation. The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is used to measure inflation because it measures changes in the average price level of a basket of consumer goods. The GDP deflator also measures inflation because it is calculated by dividing nominal GDP by real GDP and therefore can be used to determine inflation, so the answer is B.
Questions.question:
Which of the following indices are used to measure inflation
I. GDP
II. CPI
III. GDP Deflator
IV. UBI
options:
I only

 II and III only

 I, II, and IV only

 II and IV only

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: C is the correct answer because invested capital allows for more production in the future, resulting in a rightward shift of the long-run aggregate supply curve. None of the other options will guarantee to shift LRAS to the right.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: C is the correct answer because invested capital allows for more production in the future, resulting in a rightward shift of the long-run aggregate supply curve. None of the other options will guarantee to shift LRAS to the right.

options:
An increase in the interest rate

 A decrease in the inflation rate

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: Both A and D are considered used goods and therefore not counted toward GDP and C is counted under consumption because it is a consumer good. B on the other hand is an investment because the oven is being used to enhance the business.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: Both A and D are considered used goods and therefore not counted toward GDP and C is counted under consumption because it is a consumer good. B on the other hand is an investment because the oven is being used to enhance the business.

options:
A landlord purchases another old property for rental income

 A pizza business buys a new oven to increase its production capacity

 The purchase of a new personal computer from Best Buy

 The purchase of a used car from car max

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: In the intermediate range of aggregate supply, the slope of the aggregate supply curve is positive and close to unit elastic, so an increase in aggregate demand will increase price and quantity (GDP).
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: In the intermediate range of aggregate supply, the slope of the aggregate supply curve is positive and close to unit elastic, so an increase in aggregate demand will increase price and quantity (GDP).
Questions.question: While in the intermediate range of the aggregate supply curve, an increase in aggregate demand increases
options:
price level only

 real GDP only

 neither price level nor real GDP

 price level and real GDP

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: Stagflation occurs when there are high levels of unemployment with high levels of inflation. High levels of unemployment are correlated with low GDP or output falling. Therefore, B is the correct answer.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: Stagflation occurs when there are high levels of unemployment with high levels of inflation. High levels of unemployment are correlated with low GDP or output falling. Therefore, B is the correct answer.
Questions.question: Stagflation occurs when
options:
There are high levels of inflation for two consecutive quarters

 There are high levels of inflation and output falls

 There is no inflation and output increases

 There is deflation and output falls

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: The economy is only in short-run equilibrium. The economy is not in long-run equilibrium because the intersection of SRAS and AD does not lie on the LRAS. After all, the economy is in a recessionary gap. Additionally, the economy is in short-run equilibrium because the short-run aggregate supply and aggregate demand intersect.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: The economy is only in short-run equilibrium. The economy is not in long-run equilibrium because the intersection of SRAS and AD does not lie on the LRAS. After all, the economy is in a recessionary gap. Additionally, the economy is in short-run equilibrium because the short-run aggregate supply and aggregate demand intersect.
Questions.question: On the graph of the aggregate supply and demand model above a recessionary gap exists, and the economy is in
options:
neither short-run nor long-run equilibrium

 long-run, but not short-run, equilibrium

 short-run equilibrium

 both long- and short-run equilibrium

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: You can figure out this answer through the process of elimination if you are unaware of what the balanced budget multiplier is. The elasticity of the LRAS is 0, the spending multiplier is 1/MPC, which is always greater than 1. The money multiplier is 1/reserve ratio which is also always greater than 1, so the answer must be d. Additionally, the balanced budget multiplier is always 1 because, for a balanced budget, revenue through taxes must equal expenditure.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: You can figure out this answer through the process of elimination if you are unaware of what the balanced budget multiplier is. The elasticity of the LRAS is 0, the spending multiplier is 1/MPC, which is always greater than 1. The money multiplier is 1/reserve ratio which is also always greater than 1, so the answer must be d. Additionally, the balanced budget multiplier is always 1 because, for a balanced budget, revenue through taxes must equal expenditure.
Questions.question: Which of the following is equal to one?
options:
The elasticity of the long-run aggregate supply curve

 The spending (or expenditure) multiplier

 The money (or banking) multiplier

 The balanced budget multiplier

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: The purchase of bonds increases the money supply, so A is incorrect. Taxes are fiscal policy so C is incorrect. Decreasing the discount rate is a form of expansionary monetary policy, so D is incorrect. Selling bonds decreases the money supply, so it is a form of contractionary monetary policy and B is the correct answer.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: The purchase of bonds increases the money supply, so A is incorrect. Taxes are fiscal policy so C is incorrect. Decreasing the discount rate is a form of expansionary monetary policy, so D is incorrect. Selling bonds decreases the money supply, so it is a form of contractionary monetary policy and B is the correct answer.
Questions.question: Which of the following would be considered contractionary monetary policy?
options:
The purchase of bonds

 The sale of bonds

 An increase in taxes

 A decrease in the discount rate

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: To counter a recession, the FED needs to implement expansionary monetary policy. In this case, the only option that presents expansionary monetary policy is the purchase of bonds because that increases the money supply, therefore the answer is D.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: To counter a recession, the FED needs to implement expansionary monetary policy. In this case, the only option that presents expansionary monetary policy is the purchase of bonds because that increases the money supply, therefore the answer is D.

options:
A decrease in taxes

 An increase in government spending

 An increase in the discount rate

 The purchase of bonds

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: Depreciation of the US dollar means that goods in the US are cheaper for international consumers and vice versa for US consumers. This will result in an increase in exports because US goods are cheaper for international consumers, therefore C is the correct answer. All of the other options would occur if the dollar appreciated.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: Depreciation of the US dollar means that goods in the US are cheaper for international consumers and vice versa for US consumers. This will result in an increase in exports because US goods are cheaper for international consumers, therefore C is the correct answer. All of the other options would occur if the dollar appreciated.

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: Fiat money refers to currency established as money and has no intrinsic value. All of the other options have intrinsic value; however dollar bills are just paper and have no intrinsic value.

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: Expansionary fiscal policy would increase inflation, increase the interest rate, and stimulate the economy. Stimulating the economy would eliminate a recessionary gap, but expand an inflationary gap, so the correct answer is A.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: Expansionary fiscal policy would increase inflation, increase the interest rate, and stimulate the economy. Stimulating the economy would eliminate a recessionary gap, but expand an inflationary gap, so the correct answer is A.

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: The aggregate demand curve is not just a simple aggregation of all of the demand curves in a country’s economy as they have to be weighted and made relative. B is correct because aggregate demand displays changes in demanded output over various price levels. None of the other options are proper ways to describe the aggregate demand curve as it is not just a horizontal or vertical sum.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: The aggregate demand curve is not just a simple aggregation of all of the demand curves in a country’s economy as they have to be weighted and made relative. B is correct because aggregate demand displays changes in demanded output over various price levels. None of the other options are proper ways to describe the aggregate demand curve as it is not just a horizontal or vertical sum.
Questions.question: The aggregate demand curve is
options:
The simple aggregate sum of all the demand curves in a country’s economy

 A representation of changes in aggregate demand over different average price levels

 A horizontal sum of market demand curves

 A vertical sum of market demand curves

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: M1 and M2 are different but overlapping measures of the money supply. M1 is the sum of currency, checking deposits, and travelers' checks. M2 is M1 plus savings deposits and some other less-liquid assets. Because M1 is part of M2, M1 cannot be larger than M2.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: M1 and M2 are different but overlapping measures of the money supply. M1 is the sum of currency, checking deposits, and travelers' checks. M2 is M1 plus savings deposits and some other less-liquid assets. Because M1 is part of M2, M1 cannot be larger than M2.
Questions.question: A difference between M1 and M2 is that

M1 is greater than M2

 M2 is M1 plus assets that are more liquid

 M2 includes savings deposits

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: An increase in the number of machines used would still require the quantity of inputs to increase. The sale of government bonds would decrease the money supply, which would decrease economic growth and is incorrect. Finally, an increase in imports would decrease GDP and therefore is incorrect. Finally, an increase in the productivity of inputs would have the desired effect and satisfies the conditions, so A is correct
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: An increase in the number of machines used would still require the quantity of inputs to increase. The sale of government bonds would decrease the money supply, which would decrease economic growth and is incorrect. Finally, an increase in imports would decrease GDP and therefore is incorrect. Finally, an increase in the productivity of inputs would have the desired effect and satisfies the conditions, so A is correct

 an increase in the number of machines used in production.

 a sale of government bonds by their central bank.

 an increase in imports in areas they lack comparative advantage.

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: When interest rates rise in a country relative to other countries, the country with higher rates gets more investment. An increase in investment increases the demand for the currency, causing the US dollar to appreciate in this case. If the dollar appreciates, the yen depreciates. Finally, when the US dollar appreciates, exports will be more expensive for other countries and imports will be cheaper in the United States, so the trade balance will move toward a deficit.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: When interest rates rise in a country relative to other countries, the country with higher rates gets more investment. An increase in investment increases the demand for the currency, causing the US dollar to appreciate in this case. If the dollar appreciates, the yen depreciates. Finally, when the US dollar appreciates, exports will be more expensive for other countries and imports will be cheaper in the United States, so the trade balance will move toward a deficit.

options:
the dollar will depreciate, the yen will depreciate, and the trade balance will move toward a deficit

 the dollar will appreciate, the yen will depreciate, and the trade balance will not be affected

 the dollar will appreciate, the yen will appreciate, and the trade balance will move toward a deficit

 the dollar will appreciate, the yen will depreciate, and the trade balance will move toward a deficit

Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: A is incorrect because an increase in the supply of reals in the Forex market is not seen on the graph that it would decrease the price of Reals. Questions.correct_ans_explanation: In the intermediate range of aggregate supply, a shift along the aggregate supply curve results in a change in price and output. If there is an increase in aggregate demand, the shift of the aggregate demand curve will result in the equilibrium price level being higher and output being higher. Also, when output is higher, the unemployment rate is lower, so the correct answer is A.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: In the intermediate range of aggregate supply, a shift along the aggregate supply curve results in a change in price and output. If there is an increase in aggregate demand, the shift of the aggregate demand curve will result in the equilibrium price level being higher and output being higher. Also, when output is higher, the unemployment rate is lower, so the correct answer is A.

options:
unemployment will decrease, price level and output will increase

 price level and unemployment will decrease, output will increase

 price level and output will decrease, unemployment will increase

 all three will decrease

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: C is the definition of crowding out. When the government borrows money, it does not care much about the interest rate, so a shortage of funds will drive the interest rate in the loanable funds market up. These higher interest rates decrease investment in the private sector because loanable funds are more expensive, and this is one of the main issues with deficit spending.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: C is the definition of crowding out. When the government borrows money, it does not care much about the interest rate, so a shortage of funds will drive the interest rate in the loanable funds market up. These higher interest rates decrease investment in the private sector because loanable funds are more expensive, and this is one of the main issues with deficit spending.
Questions.question: Crowding out due to government borrowing (deficit spending) occurs when
options:
lower interest rates decrease private sector investment.

 a smaller money supply decreases private sector investment.

 higher interest rates decrease private sector investment.

 lower interest rates increase private sector investment.

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: The discount rate is one of the three ways the Federal Reserve changes the US money supply; the other two ways are open market operations such as quantitative easing and changing the reserve requirement. The discount rate is the interest rate that the federal reserve charges banks for emergency funds, and by decreasing the discount rate, the federal reserve can increase liquidity, and therefore the money supply.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: The discount rate is one of the three ways the Federal Reserve changes the US money supply; the other two ways are open market operations such as quantitative easing and changing the reserve requirement. The discount rate is the interest rate that the federal reserve charges banks for emergency funds, and by decreasing the discount rate, the federal reserve can increase liquidity, and therefore the money supply.

options:
prime rate

 discount rate

 demand for money

 velocity of money

 Brazilian investment in other countries will be more difficult

 Brazilian Reals are worthless in the foreign exchange market

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: Self Explanatory
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: Self Explanatory
Questions.question: The “economic problem” centers around:
options:
unlimited human wants with limited resources

 limited human wants with limited resources

 unlimited human wants with unlimited resources

 limited human wants with unlimited resources

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: The money multiplier is 1/reserve requirement. In this case, the money multiplier is 4 because a deposit of $1,000 expands the money supply by $4,000 when you include the initial deposit. Now that we know the money multiplier, we can determine the reserve requirement because the reserve requirement = 1/money multiplier = ¼ = 0.25. Therefore the reserve ratio is 25%
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: The money multiplier is 1/reserve requirement. In this case, the money multiplier is 4 because a deposit of $1,000 expands the money supply by $4,000 when you include the initial deposit. Now that we know the money multiplier, we can determine the reserve requirement because the reserve requirement = 1/money multiplier = ¼ = 0.25. Therefore the reserve ratio is 25%
Questions.question: Assuming a brand new deposit of $1,000 is made. The total money supply, including the new deposit, expands by $4000. The reserve requirement must be

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: Nerbo has an opportunity cost of 3lbs of oranges for each ream of paper while Arbec has an opportunity cost of 1/2lb of oranges for each ream of paper. At 2 reams of paper = 1/4 lb of oranges, Nerbo can get reams of paper for much cheaper than his opportunity cost; however, Arbec, who has a comparative advantage in the production of reams, does not benefit from trading as it costs him 2 reams of paper for 1 pound of oranges without trade but 4 reams for 1 pound with trading.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: Nerbo has an opportunity cost of 3lbs of oranges for each ream of paper while Arbec has an opportunity cost of 1/2lb of oranges for each ream of paper. At 2 reams of paper = 1/4 lb of oranges, Nerbo can get reams of paper for much cheaper than his opportunity cost; however, Arbec, who has a comparative advantage in the production of reams, does not benefit from trading as it costs him 2 reams of paper for 1 pound of oranges without trade but 4 reams for 1 pound with trading.
Questions.question: Arbec and Nerbo both produce paper and oranges. Using all of their resources, Arbec can produce 20 reams of paper OR 10lbs of oranges. Nerbo can produce 20 reams of paper OR 60 lbs of oranges. Assuming specialization, if the WTO enforces the terms of trade at 2 reams of paper = 1/4 lb of oranges, then
options:
absolute advantage has been lost.

 both countries would benefit.

 only Arbec would benefit.

 only Nerbo would benefit.

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: Self Explanatory
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: Self Explanatory
Questions.question: Which describes how the BEA handles the purchases of brand new homes when calculating nominal GDP?
options:
new homes are not counted

 houses are counted as land purchases rather than capital purchases

 new homes are considered an investment and counted under the investment category

 houses are counted as consumption since consumers buy them

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: While A could be true, it is not guaranteed to be true as most people are hurt by inflation, especially if they were holding their wealth in the form of cash. B is not true because that constricts the money supply. C is wrong because creditors are hurt as they lend out money and when that money has returned it is worthless. Finally, D is correct because lenders are hurt as the money they get back is worth less than the money they lend out.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: While A could be true, it is not guaranteed to be true as most people are hurt by inflation, especially if they were holding their wealth in the form of cash. B is not true because that constricts the money supply. C is wrong because creditors are hurt as they lend out money and when that money has returned it is worthless. Finally, D is correct because lenders are hurt as the money they get back is worth less than the money they lend out.
Questions.question: Anticipated inflation in year X was 3%. Actual inflation was 8%. Given these numbers, which statement must be true?
options:
Borrowers have been helped.

 The Fed has sold treasury bonds.

 Creditors have been helped.

 Lenders have been hurt.

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: The government controls fiscal policy so any choices with monetary policy can immediately be eliminated. Next, because of large amounts of cyclical unemployment, expansionary fiscal policy would correct the problem in the short run, and there are two ways to implement that -- reducing taxes and increasing government spending. Because D includes both of these it is the best answer choice.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: The government controls fiscal policy so any choices with monetary policy can immediately be eliminated. Next, because of large amounts of cyclical unemployment, expansionary fiscal policy would correct the problem in the short run, and there are two ways to implement that -- reducing taxes and increasing government spending. Because D includes both of these it is the best answer choice.
Questions.question: When confronted with large amounts of cyclical unemployment, the most effective strategy a government can take to correct the problem in the short run is
options:
implement an expansionary monetary policy.

 increase purchases of foreign assets

 recalculate the way unemployment is measured

 cut taxes and increase government spending.

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: When there is a shift in the LRAS, there has been a change in the productive capabilities of a country. In this case, the LRAS has shifted to the right so productive capacity has increased. If the amount of goods a country can produce has increased, then the production possibilities curve must have shifted to the right, so B is the correct answer.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: When there is a shift in the LRAS, there has been a change in the productive capabilities of a country. In this case, the LRAS has shifted to the right so productive capacity has increased. If the amount of goods a country can produce has increased, then the production possibilities curve must have shifted to the right, so B is the correct answer.
Questions.question: Which other change matches the shift seen in this graph?
options:
a rightward shift of a Laffer Curve

 a rightward shift of a PPC

 a rightward shift of Money Supply in the Money Market

 a leftward shift of a PPC

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: A large purchase of bonds will increase the money supply, decreasing the interest rate, decreasing foreign investment in the United States, causing the US dollar to depreciate, so the correct answer is C.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: A large purchase of bonds will increase the money supply, decreasing the interest rate, decreasing foreign investment in the United States, causing the US dollar to depreciate, so the correct answer is C.
Questions.question: A large bond purchase by the Federal Reserve will have which effect on the international value of the dollar?
options:
appreciate, because interest rates will increase

 depreciate, because tax rates are likely to increase

 depreciate, because the supply of dollars will increase

 depreciate, because interest rates will increase

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: Choice I is simply incorrect as one the discount rate is the rate the FED charges banks. Choice II is the definition of the Federal Funds Rate, so it is correct. From that you can determine that B is the only answer; however, III is also correct because open market operations indirectly change interest rates in the market as a whole through the FED buying and selling different securities.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: Choice I is simply incorrect as one the discount rate is the rate the FED charges banks. Choice II is the definition of the Federal Funds Rate, so it is correct. From that you can determine that B is the only answer; however, III is also correct because open market operations indirectly change interest rates in the market as a whole through the FED buying and selling different securities.
Questions.question:
Which of the following are true statements about the Federal Funds Rate?
I. It is the same thing as the discount rate.
II. It is the interest rate that banks charge each other for short-term loans.
III. It can be influenced by open market operations.
options:
I and III only

 II and III only

 I only

 I, II, and III

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: A leftward shift in the Phillips curve is caused by a rightward shift in aggregate supply and vice versa. This is because a rightward shift in aggregate supply decreases the price level but also increases output, which is the same as a decrease in inflation and unemployment at all levels as seen in the graph.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: A leftward shift in the Phillips curve is caused by a rightward shift in aggregate supply and vice versa. This is because a rightward shift in aggregate supply decreases the price level but also increases output, which is the same as a decrease in inflation and unemployment at all levels as seen in the graph.
Questions.question: The shift from SRPC to SRPC2 would be caused by
options:
an increase in aggregate demand.

 a decrease in aggregate demand.

 a credit in the balance of payments.

 an increase in aggregate supply.

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: If there is unanticipated inflation, the value of the future dollar is lower than expected, so a foreign government that has to repay a loan will be paying the loan back with money that is worthless. Whenever there is unanticipated inflation, the borrowers benefit, and the lenders are harmed because the money is worthless when it is repaid, and because of this, A is the correct answer as the foreign government is the entity that is lending the money.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: If there is unanticipated inflation, the value of the future dollar is lower than expected, so a foreign government that has to repay a loan will be paying the loan back with money that is worthless. Whenever there is unanticipated inflation, the borrowers benefit, and the lenders are harmed because the money is worthless when it is repaid, and because of this, A is the correct answer as the foreign government is the entity that is lending the money.
Questions.question: How does unanticipated inflation in the United States affect a foreign government repaying a loan with a fixed rate of interest to the United States?
options:
They benefit because they get to repay the loan with worthless dollars.

 They lose because the amount of the loan will increase by the rate of inflation.

 This question cannot be answered because the US only makes adjustable-rate loans.

 They benefit because they get to pay back less money to the United States.

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: Money market is more about the money supply in the economy. The market for loanable funds is not about the money supply, but about the demand, so they use the real interest rate instead of nominal interest.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: Money market is more about the money supply in the economy. The market for loanable funds is not about the money supply, but about the demand, so they use the real interest rate instead of nominal interest.
Questions.question: One major difference between the loanable funds market and the money market is
options:
real interest rates are determined by the money market and nominal interest rates by the money market.

 the Fed can only influence the money market.

 the loanable funds market drives real interest rates and the money market drives nominal rates.

 investment is responsive to the money market, but not the loanable funds market.

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: A move right along the Phillips Curve means that there has been a leftward move along the aggregate supply curve because of the relationship between aggregate supply and the Phillips curve. In order to have a leftward move along the aggregate supply curve, there must have been a decrease in aggregate demand. The only option that could cause aggregate demand to decrease is raising taxes so A is the correct answer.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: A move right along the Phillips Curve means that there has been a leftward move along the aggregate supply curve because of the relationship between aggregate supply and the Phillips curve. In order to have a leftward move along the aggregate supply curve, there must have been a decrease in aggregate demand. The only option that could cause aggregate demand to decrease is raising taxes so A is the correct answer.
Questions.question: Which fiscal policy would lead to a move right along a Phillips Curve?
options:
raising taxes

 selling treasury bonds

 increasing government spending

 decreasing the discount rate

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: I is correct because if real income increases, more US citizens will buy both domestic and international goods, causing imports to increase. II is correct because if the relative price level of US goods increases, international goods will be relatively cheaper so there will be more imports. III is incorrect because it would not cause an IMMEDIATE increase in imports; however, over time, more capital investment would appreciate the US dollar and make international goods cheaper, increasing imports. IV is incorrect because tariffs would decrease imports.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: I is correct because if real income increases, more US citizens will buy both domestic and international goods, causing imports to increase. II is correct because if the relative price level of US goods increases, international goods will be relatively cheaper so there will be more imports. III is incorrect because it would not cause an IMMEDIATE increase in imports; however, over time, more capital investment would appreciate the US dollar and make international goods cheaper, increasing imports. IV is incorrect because tariffs would decrease imports.
Questions.question:
In the United States, an increase in which of the following will likely cause an immediate increase in US imports?
I. per capita real income
II. relative price level of US goods
III. interest rates in the United States
IV. tariffs placed on imports
options:
II, III, and IV only

 I and II only

 I only

 III and IV only

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: Because money is flowing out of the United States into a foreign country, this transaction is considered a debt. Also because stock ownership is considered a financial investment, it is part of the financial/capital account, so the correct answer is B.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: Because money is flowing out of the United States into a foreign country, this transaction is considered a debt. Also because stock ownership is considered a financial investment, it is part of the financial/capital account, so the correct answer is B.
Questions.question: When a United States citizen purchases stock in a foreign exchange, like Japan’s Nikkei, the actual stock ownership is recorded as a
options:
an import under balance of trade

 debit to our capital/financial account

 credit to our capital/financial account

 credit to our current account

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: There are two types of production possibilities curves, a bowed out curve and a straight curve. A bowed out curve means that there is an increasing opportunity cost and this is due to differences between the goods and resource utilization. For example resources between robots and pizzas are very different so there is an increasing opportunity cost. On the other hand, straight PPC occurs when the resources for the goods are very similar because there is no increasing opportunity cost. In the graph seen, the PPC is straight, so the correct answer is D
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: There are two types of production possibilities curves, a bowed out curve and a straight curve. A bowed out curve means that there is an increasing opportunity cost and this is due to differences between the goods and resource utilization. For example resources between robots and pizzas are very different so there is an increasing opportunity cost. On the other hand, straight PPC occurs when the resources for the goods are very similar because there is no increasing opportunity cost. In the graph seen, the PPC is straight, so the correct answer is D
Questions.question: The shape of this production possibilities curve indicates that
options:
goods X and Y are essentially the same good.

 the opportunity cost for producing 1 additional good X is an increasing amount of good Y.

 there is no tradeoff when producing goods X and Y.

 the resources used for goods X and Y are interchangeable at a constant rate.

Questions.correct_ans_explanation: In order to eliminate an inflationary gap, aggregate demand or supply must be shifted to the left. Aggregate demand can be shifted to the left through contractionary fiscal or monetary policy. A is contractionary fiscal policy, so it can be eliminated. B would result in a leftward shift in aggregate demand because net exports are a component of GDP, so it would help escape the gap. C is contractionary fiscal policy, so it would decrease aggregate demand. Finally, D is expansionary monetary policy, so it would increase the inflationary gap, not decrease it, so it is the correct answer.
Questions.wrong_ans_explanation: In order to eliminate an inflationary gap, aggregate demand or supply must be shifted to the left. Aggregate demand can be shifted to the left through contractionary fiscal or monetary policy. A is contractionary fiscal policy, so it can be eliminated. B would result in a leftward shift in aggregate demand because net exports are a component of GDP, so it would help escape the gap. C is contractionary fiscal policy, so it would decrease aggregate demand. Finally, D is expansionary monetary policy, so it would increase the inflationary gap, not decrease it, so it is the correct answer.
Questions.question: An inflationary gap can be eliminated by all of the following EXCEPT:
options:
increase in personal income taxes.

 decrease in net exports

 decrease in government spending

 increase in money supply
